105.author: Bert Christman, script? ; Bert Christman, art
105.appears_in: 6 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 42 (Sept. 1939) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives v. 1.
notes: Sandman origin details given (he was in the service six years ago) ; villain Teeter Sneed is introduced and dies ; introduction of Dr. Clyde Dunlap and Happy O'Shea, who with Wes Dodds make up the "three Sandmen" ; introduction of Steve Weber.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

notes: Soldier Ungenio impresses the sergeant with his lack of military skills.

110.heading: Military Spending.
110.title: "I Met Her Dumpster-Diving Behind Trader Vic's"
110.author: by Garry Trudeau.
notes: Summary: Elmont and Alice talk about how they met; Elmont uses the occasion to decry wasteful military spending.

111.heading: Military Spending.
111.title: "Mr. Reagan's Ability to Reconcile Huge Tax Cuts with Massive Military Spending Must Be Viewed with Some Sympathy"
111.author: G
111.appears_in: B. Trudeau. reprinted on p. 42 of Mother Jones, v. 6, no. 2 (Feb./Mar. 1981)
notes: Summary: Hedley points out the results of sleep deprivation on Reagan's cerebrum, usually charged with logic and critical thinking but now compensating with hallucination.

112.heading: Military Strategy.
112.title: "Admiral William D. Leahy" 4 p. in Real Life Comics, no. 16
112.author: [No author]
notes: "A heavy responsibility rests upon the shoulders of the top man of the Nation's armed forces. He coordinates military and naval strategy for a global offensive!"

113.heading: Military Strategy.
113.title: "General Montgomery : Little 'Montie,' Military Giant!" 6 p. in Real Life Comics, no. 14
113.author: [No author]
notes: "As embattled democracy takes the offensive, brave hearts everywhere beat quicker to the name of a great and daring military strategist, General Sir Bernard Law Montgomery!"

116.heading: Military Technology.
116.title: "The Winds are Famously Tricky on This Course"
116.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: If McDivot makes the putt, Tiger Woods doesn't play and the ratings are in the toilet; military stealth technology goes into play.

117.heading: Military Thugs.
117.title: "Love Can Move Mountains of Dirty Dishes"
117.author: by Lind.
notes: Undated strip; date is that of publication in Eye (Toronto, Ont.)
Key words: Begging, will work for food, military thugs, Somalia, homeless, topless single mothers, compassion dollars, blackmail. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Somalia"

122.heading: Militias.
122.title: "The Coalition is Continuing Offensive Operations to Establish a Stable Iraq"
122.author: G
notes: Summary: The enemies are "Al Quaeda, the Sadr militia, the Zarqawi network, Baathist insurgents, Hezbollah, the Sunni mujahedien and foreign jihads," plus some dead-enders.

123.heading: Militias.
123.title: "The Ludlow Massacre"
123.author: Leonard Rifas
notes: About militia attacking striking coal miners in 1914.
